Class Pool

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Pool
public class Pool
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a pool of list cells. It also maintains some statistics about the pool usage.

Constructor Summary
Pool()
           
 
Method Summary
 List acquire()
          Acquire a list cell.
 void release(List list)
          Return a list cell to the pool.
 void statistics()
          Print on standard output the number of cell nodes that have been constructed, that have been created, and that are held by the pool since the beginning of execution.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
, clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Pool

public Pool()
Method Detail

acquire

public List acquire()
Acquire a list cell. The cell is recycled from the pool if any is available; otherwise it is created by the list cell constructor.
Returns:
A list cell.

release

public void release(List list)
Return a list cell to the pool.
Parameters:
list - The list cell to return to the pool.

statistics

public void statistics()
Print on standard output the number of cell nodes that have been constructed, that have been created, and that are held by the pool since the beginning of execution.
